channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO

item.title: Report E-2024010107
item.description:
Report E-2024010107

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UDV experienced a UN2929 Sulfix 9272 Scavenger release from (2) 330-gallon poly totes. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 70-gallons of product released to a 10’ x 10’ area of the trailer floor and a 20’ x 20’ area of the asphalt lot below. The totes were punctured by metal sticking out from the trailer wall. Each tote was transferred into two new totes for shipment on. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The impacted absorbents were then collected into (2) 55-gallon poly, (3) 55-gallon metal, and (3) 95-gallon poly drums. The two damaged totes were then cut up and containerized into (1) 95-gallon poly and (1) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024010297
item.description:
Report X-2024010297

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-17T15:11:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-23
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Plastic jugs in corrugated carton with corrugated divider. Liquid leaked from under cap of one jug as if contents froze and expanded in transit. Leakage soiled other jugs and damaged carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: This hazmat was discovered by a manager during preload who called QA. QA placed hazmat in a plastic bag and red tote and placed it in the fumigator within the hazmat cage. DescribePack: The hazmat has a loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was placed in a plastic bag and red tote.

  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The damage was discovered in the unload. The unload manager called out for an Admin's assistance in containing the damaged hazmat. DescribePack: The shipment leaked contents through what appears to be a loose closure. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The responding Admin contained the shipment in a hazardous material spill tote and transported the shipment to the hazmat cage for processing.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to trailer 568511 due to a leaking pail and QA placed inside a tote and took to hazmat cage to get inspected. DescribePack: Top of the pail was dented due to it being mishandled and that is where the leakage occured and it leaked out over label. DurationRel: 9 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. was placed inside a lined tote and was taken to hazmat cage to get inspected.
